Package prelim.SinglyLinkedList

Class MySinglyLinkedList<E>

java.lang.Object
prelim.SinglyLinkedList.MySinglyLinkedList<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of elements held in this list
All Implemented Interfaces:
MyLinkedList<E>
public class MySinglyLinkedList<E> extends Object implements MyLinkedList<E>
A generic implementation of a singly linked list.

    • MySinglyLinkedList

  • Method Details

    • addToHead

      public void addToHead(E data)
      Adds a new element to the head of the list.

      The algorithm for adding to the head: 1. Create a new node with the given data, setting its next reference to the current head. 2. Update the head to be the new node. 3. If the list was empty (i.e., head was null), set the tail to be the new node as well. 4. Increment the size of the list.

      Specified by:
      addToHead in interface MyLinkedList<E>
      Parameters:
      data - the data to be added to the head of the list

    • addToTail

      public void addToTail(E data)
      Adds a new element to the tail of the list.

      The algorithm for adding to the tail: 1. Create a new node with the given data and no next node. 2. If the tail is not null, set its next reference to the new node. 3. Update the tail to be the new node. 4. If the list was empty (i.e., tail was null), set the head to be the new node as well. 5. Increment the size of the list.

      Specified by:
      addToTail in interface MyLinkedList<E>
      Parameters:
      data - the data to be added to the tail of the list

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the number of elements in the list.
      Specified by:
      getSize in interface MyLinkedList<E>
      Returns:
      the number of elements in the list

    • remove

      public void remove(E data)
      Removes the first occurrence of the specified element from the list.

      The algorithm for removing an element: 1. Check if the list is empty (i.e., head is null). If so, exit the method. 2. If the head node contains the data to be removed, update the head to be the next node. - If the new head is null (i.e., the list becomes empty), also set the tail to null. 3. Otherwise, traverse the list starting from the head. 4. For each node, check if the next node contains the data to be removed. 5. If a match is found: - Update the current node's next reference to skip the node containing the data. - If the removed node was the tail, update the tail to be the current node. - Decrement the size of the list. 6. Continue until the end of the list or until the element is found.

      Specified by:
      remove in interface MyLinkedList<E>
      Parameters:
      data - the data to be removed from the list

    • isDeleted

      public boolean isDeleted(E data)
      Checks whether the specified element has been deleted from the list.

      The algorithm for checking if an element is deleted: 1. Traverse the list starting from the head. 2. For each node, check if the data matches the specified element. 3. If a match is found, return false indicating the element is not deleted. 4. Continue until the end of the list. 5. If the element is not found in the list, return true indicating the element is deleted.

      Specified by:
      isDeleted in interface MyLinkedList<E>
      Parameters:
      data - the data to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the element is not present in the list, false otherwise
